published_time: 2025-07-01 09:19:28-04:00
source_url: https://www.whitehouse.gov/articles/2025/07/no-tax-on-social-security-is-a-reality-in-the-one-big-beautiful-bill/
tags: articles
title: No Tax on Social Security is a Reality in the One Big Beautiful Bill
---
 
**Under the One Big Beautiful Bill, the vast majority of senior citizens
— 88% of all seniors who receive Social Security — will pay NO TAX on
their Social Security benefits, according to a** [**brand new
analysis**](https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/The-One-Big-Beautiful-Bill-Delivers-On-President-Trumps-Promise-Of-No-Tax-On-Social-Security.pdf)
**from the Council of Economic Advisers.**

<figure>
<img
src="https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/opt-socialsecurity-cea-1.jpg"
style="width:750px" decoding="async" data-fetchpriority="high"
sizes="(max-width: 1026px) 100vw, 1026px"
srcset="https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/opt-socialsecurity-cea-1.jpg 1026w, https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/opt-socialsecurity-cea-1.jpg?resize=600,201 600w, https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/opt-socialsecurity-cea-1.jpg?resize=768,257 768w"
width="1026" height="344" />
<img
src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," />
</figure>

-   A senior who files as a single taxpayer and receives the current
    average retirement benefit ([approx.
    $24,000](https://www.ssa.gov/faqs/en/questions/KA-01903.html)) will
    see deductions that exceed their taxable Social Security income.
-   Married seniors who both receive the average $24,000 Social Security
    income — a total of $48,000 in annual income — will also see
    deductions that exceed their taxable Social Security income.

<figure>
<img
src="https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/opt-socialsecurity-cea-2.jpg"
style="width:750px" decoding="async"
sizes="(max-width: 1135px) 100vw, 1135px"
srcset="https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/opt-socialsecurity-cea-2.jpg 1135w, https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/opt-socialsecurity-cea-2.jpg?resize=600,141 600w, https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/opt-socialsecurity-cea-2.jpg?resize=768,180 768w"
width="1135" height="266" />
<img
src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," />
</figure>

This amounts to the largest tax break in history for America’s seniors —
and makes sure that after years of earning their Social Security,
seniors can save more of their money.

Promises made, promises kept.
